Original question: Consider the formation of MgO (s). Assume that ΔH r° and ΔSr° are independent of temperature. Mg (s) + 1/2 O2 (g) → MgO (s). ΔH r° = -602 kJ/mol. ΔSr° = -108 JK-1mol-1. Is there a temperature at which the formation of MgO switches from spontaneous to nonspontaneous or vice versa? If no, explain briefly why not. If yes, calculate the temperature (T*) at which the spontaneity of the reaction switches.
